<a id="CylinderMesh"></a>

# CylinderMesh

**Inherits:** [PrimitiveMesh](PrimitiveMesh.md) **\<** [Mesh](Mesh.md) **\<** [Resource](Resource.md) **\<** [RefCounted](RefCounted.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

Class representing a cylindrical [PrimitiveMesh](PrimitiveMesh.md).

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

Class representing a cylindrical [PrimitiveMesh](PrimitiveMesh.md). This class can be used to create cones by setting either the [top_radius](CylinderMesh.md#CylinderMesh_property_top_radius) or [bottom_radius](CylinderMesh.md#CylinderMesh_property_bottom_radius) properties to ``0.0``.

<!-- classref-reftable-group -->

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Property Descriptions

<a id="CylinderMesh_property_bottom_radius"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **bottom_radius** = `0.5` [ðŸ”—](#CylinderMesh_property_bottom_radius)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_bottom_radius**\ (\ value\: [float](float.md)\ )
- [float](float.md) **get_bottom_radius**\ (\ )

Bottom radius of the cylinder. If set to ``0.0``, the bottom faces will not be generated, resulting in a conic shape. See also [cap_bottom](CylinderMesh.md#CylinderMesh_property_cap_bottom).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="CylinderMesh_property_cap_bottom"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **cap_bottom** = `true` [ðŸ”—](#CylinderMesh_property_cap_bottom)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_cap_bottom**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **is_cap_bottom**\ (\ )

If ``true``, generates a cap at the bottom of the cylinder. This can be set to ``false`` to speed up generation and rendering when the cap is never seen by the camera. See also [bottom_radius](CylinderMesh.md#CylinderMesh_property_bottom_radius).

\ **Note:** If [bottom_radius](CylinderMesh.md#CylinderMesh_property_bottom_radius) is ``0.0``, cap generation is always skipped even if [cap_bottom](CylinderMesh.md#CylinderMesh_property_cap_bottom) is ``true``.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="CylinderMesh_property_cap_top"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **cap_top** = `true` [ðŸ”—](#CylinderMesh_property_cap_top)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_cap_top**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **is_cap_top**\ (\ )

If ``true``, generates a cap at the top of the cylinder. This can be set to ``false`` to speed up generation and rendering when the cap is never seen by the camera. See also [top_radius](CylinderMesh.md#CylinderMesh_property_top_radius).

\ **Note:** If [top_radius](CylinderMesh.md#CylinderMesh_property_top_radius) is ``0.0``, cap generation is always skipped even if [cap_top](CylinderMesh.md#CylinderMesh_property_cap_top) is ``true``.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="CylinderMesh_property_height"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **height** = `2.0` [ðŸ”—](#CylinderMesh_property_height)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_height**\ (\ value\: [float](float.md)\ )
- [float](float.md) **get_height**\ (\ )

Full height of the cylinder.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="CylinderMesh_property_radial_segments"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[int](int.md) **radial_segments** = `64` [ðŸ”—](#CylinderMesh_property_radial_segments)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_radial_segments**\ (\ value\: [int](int.md)\ )
- [int](int.md) **get_radial_segments**\ (\ )

Number of radial segments on the cylinder. Higher values result in a more detailed cylinder/cone at the cost of performance.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="CylinderMesh_property_rings"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[int](int.md) **rings** = `4` [ðŸ”—](#CylinderMesh_property_rings)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_rings**\ (\ value\: [int](int.md)\ )
- [int](int.md) **get_rings**\ (\ )

Number of edge rings along the height of the cylinder. Changing [rings](CylinderMesh.md#CylinderMesh_property_rings) does not have any visual impact unless a shader or procedural mesh tool is used to alter the vertex data. Higher values result in more subdivisions, which can be used to create smoother-looking effects with shaders or procedural mesh tools (at the cost of performance). When not altering the vertex data using a shader or procedural mesh tool, [rings](CylinderMesh.md#CylinderMesh_property_rings) should be kept to its default value.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="CylinderMesh_property_top_radius"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **top_radius** = `0.5` [ðŸ”—](#CylinderMesh_property_top_radius)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_top_radius**\ (\ value\: [float](float.md)\ )
- [float](float.md) **get_top_radius**\ (\ )

Top radius of the cylinder. If set to ``0.0``, the top faces will not be generated, resulting in a conic shape. See also [cap_top](CylinderMesh.md#CylinderMesh_property_cap_top).
